Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2009 05:26PM MapleTree wrote: I'm trying to send out good calm energy to all of you who are having such misery with drains.  I loathed mine, but I didn't have anything like the problems of swimangel or rferraris.  However, I do want to urge people who are about to have mastectomies or lumpectomies to ask their surgeons what percentage of their patients get seromas.  Many surgeons have rates as high as 50%, but my surgeon has a rate of half of one percent--partly because he waits until the drain output is 15cc's or less for two days following.  That's a really tiny amount.  It was agonizing to wait for the output to get that low, but seromas are much more agonizing, so patience is important.  (One would think, however, that someone could invent a draining method less painful than the one currently available.)  (Uh-oh.  I don't want to frighten people who haven't yet had their mastectomies, so I'll add this: the pain from drains isn't intense for most people; it's just like a small cut that won't heal, so it wears you down.)
